GridConnectivity#

Module Contents#

Classes#

GridConnectivity

This class constructs the connectivity for the oscillatory network.
class GridConnectivity.GridConnectivity(nr_excit, nr_inhibit, nr_oscillators)#

This class constructs the connectivity for the oscillatory network.

Parameters

  • nr_excit (int) – number of excitatory neurons in the network.

  • nr_inhibit (int) – number of inhibitory neurons in the network.

  • nr_oscillators (int) – number of oscillators in the network.

Raises

AssertionError: if number of excitatory neurons doesn’t divide the number of oscillators as there should be an equal number of excitatory neurons in each oscillator.

Raises

AssertionError: if number of inhibitory neurons doesn’t divide the number of oscillators as there should be an equal number of inhibitory neurons in each oscillator.

Raises

AssertionError: if the number of oscillators is not a square as oscillators should be arranged in a square grid.

Variables

  • nr_excit – number of excitatory neurons in the network.

  • nr_inhibit – number of inhibitory neurons in the network.

  • nr_oscillators – number of oscillators in the network.

  • K – Matrix of all coupling weights.

assign_oscillators(self)#

Creates oscillators, assigns grid locations to them, and adds the same number of neurons of each type to them.

Returns

list of oscillators in the network and a dictionary mapping a neuron to the oscillator it belongs to.

Return type

tuple[list[Oscillator], dict[NeuronTypes: dict[int, int]]]

get_KXXs(self, nr_excit, nr_inhibit, oscillators, neuron_oscillator_map)#

Computes the coupling weights between all neurons.

Parameters

  • nr_excit – number of excitatory neurons.

  • nr_inhibit – number of inhibitory neurons.

  • oscillators (list[Oscillator]) – list of oscillators in the network.

  • neuron_oscillator_map (dict[NeuronTypes: dict[int, int]]) – a dictionary mapping a neuron to the oscillator it belongs to.

Returns

coupling strengths for EE, II, EI, IE connections.

Return type

tuple[list[list[int]]]

_compute_KXX(self, dist, XX, sXX)#

Computes the coupling weights for connections between two types of neurons.

Parameters

  • dist (list[list[float]]) – distance matrix with pairwise distances between neurons.

  • XX (float) – max connection strength between neuron types.

  • sXX (float) – spatial constant for the neuron types.

Returns

the matrix of coupling weights of size nr1 x nr2, where n1 and nr2 - number of neurons of

each type in the coupling of ineterest. :rtype: list[list[float]]

_get_neurons_dist(self, X1, X2, nr1, nr2, oscillators, neuron_oscillator_map)#

Computes the matrix of Euclidian distances between two types of neurons.

Parameters

  • X1 (NeuronTypes) – neurons type 1

  • X2 (NeuronTypes) – neurons type 2

  • nr1 (int) – number of neurons of type 1

  • nr2 (int) – number of neurons of type 2

  • oscillators (list[Oscillator]) – list of oscillators in the network.

  • neuron_oscillator_map (dict[NeuronTypes: dict[int, int]]) – a dictionary mapping a neuron to the oscillator it belongs to.

Returns

The matrix nr1 x nr2 of pairwise distances between neurons.

Return type

list[list[float]]

get_K(self, nr_excit, nr_inhibit, KEE, KII, KEI, KIE)#

Assigns coupling weights.

Parameters

  • nr_excit (int) – number of excitatory neurons in the network.

  • nr_inhibit (int) – number of inhibitory neurons in the network.

  • KIE (KEE, KII, KEI,) – coupling weights of respective connections.

Returns

matrix of all coupling weights.

Return type

ndarray[ndarray[float]]
